page.title: 13TYTHERINGTON SCHOOL CLOSURE
page.content:
The village school was closed at the end of the Summer term in{1983. 28} pupils were attending the school when it closed. The{local authority}closed the school for many reasons, such as{ {falling pupil numbers}and{rising costs of educational equipment. Many of the children who went to the school now go to either{St.Helen's}in{Alveston}or{ {Marlwood.}Some of the local people campaigned for two years to keep the school open, but failed. We asked a sample of local people if they agreed with the closure, and the results were:-
{66%}wanted the school to stay open; {33%}wanted the school to close; {1% }did not care.
